Cvalue Genome Size vs. Repeat Space

Source: R/plotRepeatSPaceCval.R
plotRepeatSpaceCval.Rd

Compute and visualize the correlation between genome size vs. Repeat Space.

plotRepeatSpaceCval(genome.matrix, cor.method = "spearman",
  label.organism = TRUE, smooth.method = "glm", se = TRUE,
  xlab = "Total repeats length in Mega [bp]",
  ylab = "Cvalue Genome size in Mega [bp]", main = "", alpha = 0.3,
  arrow_lab = FALSE, cl.analysis = FALSE, cl.centers = NULL,
  cl.method = "euclidean", cl.nstart = 100, cl.iter.max = 10000,
  sim.matrix = NULL, text.size = 18, label.size = 3,
  check.overlap = TRUE)

Arguments

genome.matrix

Genome matrix retruned by LTRpred.meta.
cor.method

method to correlate genome size versus protein space.
label.organism

shall organism names be drawn in the figure?
smooth.method

method to add a smoothed conditional mean (see ggplot2::geom_smooth()). Users can choose from auto, glm, lm, or loess. If no smoothing function shall be applied, users can specify smooth.method = 'NULL'.
se

shall standard error of the smoothing model (grey area) be drawn or not.
xlab

x-axis label.
ylab

y-axis label.
main

main text.
alpha

transparency of confidence interval of the smoothing function: between \[ 0,1 \].
arrow_lab

whether or not data points shall be labelled with arrows (ggrepel).
cl.analysis

logical value indicating whether or not cluster analysis of the sim.matrix returned by LTRpred.meta shall be performed (see Details sections).
cl.centers

number of expected clusters or a set of initial (distinct) cluster centres.
cl.method

distance measure to perform cluster analysis. Options are "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary", "pearson" , "abspearson" , "abscorrelation", "correlation", "spearman" or "kendall".
cl.nstart

If cl.centers is a number, number of random sets that shall be chosen.
cl.iter.max

maximum number of iterations for cluster analysis.
sim.matrix

Similarity matrix retruned by LTRpred.meta.
text.size

size of the labels in ggplot2 notation.
label.size

size of the dot-labels.
check.overlap

shall overlaps of labels be avoided or not.

Details

In the first step, users should have generated LTR retrotransposon annotations for several species using the LTRpred.meta function. The output of LTRpred.meta is a folder storing the annotation files for all species of input species. In addition, LTRpred.meta generates two files: *_SimilarityMatrix and *_GenomeInfo .

Examples

GenomeMatrix <- read.csv(system.file("GenomeMatrix.csv",package = "LTRpred"), sep = ";")
GenomeMatrix[ , 1] <- sapply(GenomeMatrix[ , 1],
                             function(x) unlist(stringr::str_split(x,"_"))[1])

plotSize(GenomeMatrix)
#> Error in stats::cor(genome.summary$total_ltrs_nucl_mbp, genome.summary$genome_size_nucl_mbp,     method = cor.method): supply both 'x' and 'y' or a matrix-like 'x'
